etymology.interpretation: A roof component evokes something covered or made whole, aligning with senses like “complete” or “intact.” 元 provides the sound value (wán) and also echoes an idea of “original/primary,” which fits the notion of being whole or finished.

examples.chinese: 我已经做完作业了(我已經做完作業了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐjīng zuò wán zuòyè le.
examples.english: I have already finished my homework.

examples.chinese: 电影还没完，我们别走(電影還沒完，我們別走)。
examples.pinyin: Diànyǐng hái méi wán, wǒmen bié zǒu.
examples.english: The movie isn’t over yet; let’s not leave.

examples.chinese: 房子经历地震后仍然完好无损(房子經歷地震後仍然完好無損)。
examples.pinyin: Fángzi jīnglì dìzhèn hòu réngrán wánhǎo wúsǔn.
examples.english: The house remained intact after the earthquake.
